Key Match Events: Sengun scored 10 points in the final period to help the Rockets put it away.
Thompson made a soaring, two-handed dunk followed by a 3 from Green made it 105-97 with less than a minute to go.
Post-Match Reflections: The Rockets did a good job of getting several players involved offensively. Four starters finished in double figures and Amen Thompson added 12 points off the bench.
Houston needs to find a way to be more consistent throughout games. They squandered a double-digit lead before pulling away late.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston led by 15 points early before the Knicks got within one late in the fourth quarter.
The Rockets won despite making just 8 of 33 3-pointers.
Green started out 0 for 6 and was 2 of 8 and VanVleet and Jabari Smith Jr. each made just 1 of 5 attempts.
